abstract.t: A list of international Xaraya domains

section.title: Introduction
section.t: The goal of Xaraya International is to leverage the international nature of the Xaraya project to further various aspects of the project, including, but not limited to:

list.t: Support
PR
User Feedback
Documentation
Having Fun

section.title: List of requirements for Xaraya International

list.t: Provide Support in many languages
Share experiences
Have a common backend to share content
Create an escalation procedure for unresolved problems
Resolve scalability issues with the main support site
Foster local communities
Attract talent to Xaraya
Spread the word about Xaraya
Raise quality accross all sites

section.t: Some of the problems we want to address with Xaraya International are:

list.t: Language barriers: not everyone speaks / understands english
Support information is hard to find
It is hard to discover language / country specific Xaraya sites
Problem reports tend not to flow back to the developers
Translated documenation is sometimes hard to find
International Support without support
News of Xaraya only in Xaraya site and not translated and put i all sites
Developpers, maybe other country have a good developper but they not speak/understand english
Xaraya project don't have Official International Support site
Comunication with Official Xaraya and other support site
News: Xaraya.com -> International sites (by hand, webmasters checking xaraya.com, modules.*, blocks.* themes.*, mailing lists..., broswing forums..., other international sites...)
Documentation: Flow broken. There are part of documentation on docs.xaraya.com, part on international sites. Without consistency of content and/or look.

Feedback: Needs to be more dinamic. Bug report on a non english site by a non english speaker right now means webmaster to understand completely bug to submit it. Some bug fixing is done on the fly on country/language specific sites
FAQ: Make a real FAQs based on experience of language-based support teams. It'll help on the way of developing end user and administrator documentation

section.title: Solution proposals
section.t: Here are some partial solution ideas. Those need to be fleshed out a lot more.

list.t: Syndication of news, forums (Mailbag?) to exchange news, forward interesting threads for archival or as input for xarFeedback (bug tracker / feature request). close the loop with the documentation / FAQ team
Heavy, deep interlinking (not just in the web links section) for instance on xaraya.it forum: go to the same forum on xaraya.com etc
Adopt a similar structure for the support forums so that they can be mapped from language to language, from main site to 3rd party sites etc
Make documentation readily available (people have trouble finding our docs, including translations
Make sure people read the FAQ before they ask problems, and related, create escalation steps to verify issues so that they can be tackled by developers
Work with documentation people to continually identify top issues, and make FAQ / docs out of them
Create language-specific IRC channels on the Xaraya IRC Network
